items.content_html:
Adds a top-level __compat feature for Math per #13804.

Also sorts the entries (not sure why it complains about this now)
items.title: Add Math __compat feature; sort

items.content_html:
Most of the methods on IntersectionObserver are marked as experimental, but all are supported by multiple browser engines. This removes that tagging.

@ddbeck I'm actually here for some advice on whether I need to record a bug/compatibility issue for this API, and if so how. Specifically, the IntersectionObserver constructor can take an option object that specifies a rootmargin. The spec and chrome allow for an empty string to be specified for this option, but until bug 1738791 was fixed in FF96 Firefox raised an exception.

Does this need to be recorded. If so, what's the best way?
items.title: IntersectionObserver is not experimental

items.content_html:
Set-Cookie > SameSite has a custom spec table. This adds the data into the compat info following attempt by user to report out of date spec in
mdn/content#11013

If this goes in, will need to update the page with {{Specifications}} macro.

Note failing due to this spec -"https://httpwg.org/http-extensions/draft-ietf-httpbis-rfc6265bis.html#name-the-samesite-attribute" - what's the right approach for this case?
items.title: HTTP Set-Cookie SameSite - add specs

items.content_html:
display_override
note_taking and new_note_url
items.title: Add new manifest members.

items.content_html:
FF96 adds support for a webp encoder https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1511670
This can be used in HTMLCanvasElement.toDataURL(), HTMLCanvasElement.toBlob(), OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob() to output webp.

The spec requires support only for the png format (used by default and as a fallback). Nothing in the spec that says a browser must support any other format.

However it is useful to know about what formats are supported. So this PR is a test to see the gods of BCD will allow reporting supported types as a subfeature (and help me update this). Currently just for toDataUrl. If this approach works would roll out to the other methods. Do not propose to add other supported types like jpg, but that could happen in time.

What I know now.

-Chrome supports webp in toDataUrl , and I think from M17 https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=63221 - Note that this is pre-Blink engine, which makes mapping to other versions hard.

  • FF96 supports webp
  • IE does not.
  • Current Opera and Edge do too. However not clear when this would have gone in.
  • No idea about the others

For toBlob, I know that support went in for Chrome 50 for the method, by which time webp was supported. So we can assume Blink mappings for the others.

Thoughts?

PS, my test html page for toDataURL support is

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Canvas - toData</title>
  </head>
  <body>
  <p>Canvas toDataURL</p>
<canvas id="canvas"></canvas>
<script>
lets ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");
ctx.fillStyle = "red";
ctx.fillRect(0, 0, 8, 8);

const webp = canvas.toDataURL("image/webp"); // Chrome only?
const png  = canvas.toDataURL("image/png");
const jpg  = canvas.toDataURL("image/jpeg");

console.log(webp.length, webp); //  263 byte
console.log(png.length, png);   // 1918 byte
console.log(jpg.length, jpg);   // 1938 byte

document.body.appendChild(new Image).src = webp;
document.body.appendChild(new Image).src = png;
document.body.appendChild(new Image).src = jpg;
</script>
  </body>
</html>
items.title: FF96 webp supported for Canvas todataurl/blob

items.content_html:
FF96 adds support for web locks API (in this release was done first in Nightly bug1739233 and then release bug 1740044.

Further, it seems to have first been implemented in FF93 behind pref (bug 1725734). Since android doesn't support preferences, I've indicated support there from FF96.

Associated with docs work in mdn/content#10859
items.title: FF96 Web Lock API supported

items.content_html:
Summary

In Gecko, screen orientation lock was implemented for old Firefox Android only (Fennec), and Fenix doesn't yet.
Also, Chromium has screen orientation lock method, but it always return rejected promise.

Test results and supporting details

see related issues links.

Related issues

  • Chrome desktop: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1274012
  • Chrome OS: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1220784
  • Firefox Android: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1697647
items.title: Update screen.orientation.lock() support data since desktop browsers reject with NotSupportedError

items.content_html:
FF96 sets a number of preferences true by default in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1617609

  • network.cookie.sameSite.laxByDefault
  • network.cookie.sameSite.noneRequiresSecure
  • network.cookie.sameSite.schemeful

This updates BCD to reflect the changes.

Other docs work for this is in mdn/content#10857
items.title: Samesite lax

items.content_html:
Summary

onappinstalled wasn't deprecated. It was moved. Support will continue for onbeforeinstallprompt. URLs for both are updated.

Test results and supporting details

https://wicg.github.io/manifest-incubations/#extensions-to-the-window-object
items.title: Fix window extensions for manifests.

items.content_html:
Summary

Adds browser support information for using format("*-variations") in the src property of the @font-face rule. Also rewords the format(keyword) entry for brevity and symmetry.

I was unsure what to do about mobile browsers for which I can't identify the initial version that supports the feature...

Test results and supporting details

Used information from Can I Use and confirmed in Browserstack with this test case, reproduced below:

font-face-src.html 
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
	<meta charset="utf-8">
	<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
	<title>@font-face/src syntax test</title>

	<style type='text/css'>
		/*
			AdobeBlank font licensed under OFL 1.1.
			A copy of the license can be consulted here:

			https://github.com/adobe-fonts/adobe-blank/blob/master/LICENSE.txt
		 */
		@font-face {
    font-family: AdobeBlank;
    src:
    url("data:font/opentype;base64,");
}

		/*
			The font declarations below used a subset of the Zilla Slab font,
			generated with the Embedded Google Fonts tool:

			https://amio.github.io/embedded-google-fonts/

			The original Zilla Slab font is licensed under OFL 1.1. 
			A copy of the license can be consulted here: 

			https://github.com/mozilla/zilla-slab/blob/master/LICENSE
		*/
		@font-face {
			font-family: woff2;
			src: url('data:font/woff2;base64,') format('woff2');
		}

		@font-face {
			font-family: woff2-kw;
			src: url('data:font/woff2;base64,') format(woff2);
		}

		@font-face {
			font-family: woff2-variations;
			src: url('data:font/woff2;base64,') format('woff2-variations');
		}

		@font-face {
			font-family: woff2-variations-kw;
			src: url('data:font/woff2;base64,') format(woff2-variations);
		}

		@font-face {
			font-family: woff2-supports-variations;
			src: url('data:font/woff2;base64,') format('woff2 supports variations');
		}

		@font-face {
			font-family: woff2-supports-variations-kw;
			src: url('data:font/woff2;base64,') format(woff2 supports variations);
		}

		@font-face {
			font-family: woff2-format-technology;
			src: url('data:font/woff2;base64,') format('woff2') technology('variations');
		}

		@font-face {
			font-family: woff2-format-technology-kw;
			src: url('data:font/woff2;base64,') format('woff2') technology(variations);
		}

		@font-face {
			font-family: woff2-format-technology-kw2;
			src: url('data:font/woff2;base64,') format(woff2) technology(variations);
		}

		body {
			max-width: 50em;
			margin: 0 auto;
		}

		dd {
			font-family: var(--font), AdobeBlank;
			font-size: 2em;
			color: green;
			margin: 0;
		}

		dl > * {
			display: flex;
			align-items: center;
		}

	</style>
</head>
<body>
	<h1><code>@font-face/src</code> syntax test</h1>
	<dl>
		<div>
			<dt><code>format('woff2')</code></dt>
			<dd style='--font: woff2'></dd>
		</div>

		<div>
			<dt><code>format(woff2)</code></dt>
			<dd style='--font: woff2-kw'></dd>
		</div>
		<div>
			<dt><code>format('woff2-variations')</code></dt>
			<dd style='--font: woff2-variations'></dd>
		</div>
		<div>
			<dt><code>format(woff2-variations)</code></dt>
			<dd style='--font: woff2-variations-kw'></dd>
		</div>
		<div>
			<dt><code>format('woff2 supports variations')</code></dt>
			<dd style='--font: woff2-supports-variations'></dd>
		</div>
		<div>
			<dt><code>format(woff2 supports variations)</code></dt>
			<dd style='--font: woff2-supports-variations-kw'></dd>
		</div>
		<div>
			<dt><code>format('woff2') technology('variations')</code></dt>
			<dd style='--font: woff2-format-technology'></dd>
		</div>
		<div>
			<dt><code>format('woff2') technology(variations)</code></dt>
			<dd style='--font: woff2-format-technology-kw'></dd>
		</div>

		<div>
			<dt><code>format(woff2) technology(variations)</code></dt>
			<dd style='--font: woff2-format-technology-kw2'></dd>
		</div>
	</dl>
</body>
</html>

Related issues

Fixes #13827.
items.title: css.at-rules.font-face.src: add browser support for format("*-variations")
